intro: Diascia maculata, commonly known as the spotted diastrum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, branching stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. Its flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom throughout the growing season, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Diascia maculata thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, requiring minimal water once established.
